Then open top 6 cards from the deck and keep it open between all players in 2*3 grid.\nSeparate the power cards from the capture cards deck.\nShuffle the capture cards deck and distribute 6 cards to each player\nDistribute 4 power cards to each player and keep the rest aside\n*For added excitement, include 4 power cards in the capture card deck during setup\nHOW TO PLAY:\nThe youngest player starts the game\nIn a turn:\nThe player will use any single or combination of capture (number) cards to solve anyone of the open monster (addition) cards.\nAfter solving the card, the player:\nWill take solved monster card from the center and keep it, then they will replace it with a new monster card from the top of the deck.\nDiscards the used capture cards and replaces them with new cards from the top of the deck.\n*All players should have 6 capture cards at any given point in the game excluding power cards given at the start of the game. Player will not get a replacement card for the power card used.\nThen the next player takes their turn to solve any one of the open monster card.\nThe game ends when all the players capture any 5 monster cards.\n*If a player is unable to solve any monster card in their turn, they can use this turn to replace all their capture cards with new ones from the top of the deck\n\nWINNER:\nPlayers add up the points on the Monster cards they earned and the player with the highest points wins the game.",

                "id": 3804,
                "category": "Board Games",
                "slug": "othello",
                "name": "OTHELLO",
                "in_stock": true,
                "stock": 2,
                "price": 599,
                "sale_price": 419.3,
                "discount_percentage": 30,
                "description": "A Minute To Learn, A Lifetime To Master! Othello is a game where not all is Black and White. The lead can change hands from play to play and strategy is everything. The play is simple. Players are represented by either Black or White discs on the board. On each turn, players flank the discs of the opposing player between two of their own. Once captured, the double-sided discs are turned over and become the opposite colour. If you have a move, you have to take it whether you want to or not. That’s all, that’s the entire game. But more and more discs fall to the opposing side with each turn. Where will it all end? Starting from just four discs to begin the game, play moves all over the board with as many as 64 discs placed by the final move. Play can end when one player can’t make any more moves OR when the board is full. To add to the fun, if you can make a move but you’re out of discs, your opponent has to give you one of theirs. That’s like arming the enemy! As you become more and more familiar with Othello, certain strategies will begin to emerge. Owning a corner is always an advantage as that protects your discs in the immediate vicinity – your opponent can’t outflank you. But is your opponent backing you towards a corner so they can try to control it themselves? That’s the strategy of Othello. Can you see enough moves ahead to make your opponent put a disc somewhere they don’t want to? A minute to learn…a lifetime to master!”",

                "description": "TOP UP YOUR PIZZA\n\nAge: 6+\nPlayers: 2-4\nTime: 15 Mins\n\nDescription:\nWho doesn’t like pizza? Get ready to experience an extremely fun family time with this easy to learn yet very challenging “ TOP UP YOUR PIZZA” game. All you have to do is top your pizza slices with matching toppings and score maximum points ! But don’t be carried away by the cuteness, this game will have you on your toes throughout while improving your strategic,problem solving and observation skills. \n\nSet-up:\nSeparate all the 4 toppings and keep it in different piles\n\nShuffle all the pizza slices and keep it faced down in a pile.Each player will pick up one slice from the top of the pile to begin the game\n\n Open up top 3 pizza slices and keep it in middle of all players\n\nObjective:\nTo score the maximum number of points by topping up your pizza slices with the matching toppings.\n\nCONTENT:\n120 Toppings tokens\n64 Pizza slices\nrulesheet\n\nHow to play:\nThe youngest player starts the game\nAt the start the first player can either:\nTake one of the 3 open pizza slices and keep it or\nTake any 2 of different toppings or 3 of the same toppings. After taking the toppings the player can fill up the matching topping on a slice and keep the rest aside for other slices\nIf the player picks up a pizza slice ,a new pizza slice is opened from the top of the pile in the middle(Anytime during the game total 3 pizza slices should be open at all times)\nThen the turn is passed onto the next player\nWhenever a player completes a slice by topping it up with the matching toppings , he/she scores the points mentioned on the slice and also takes the number of bonus toppings mentioned on the slice immediately\nLike this in every turn all players will either take a pizza slice or toppings and try to complete a full pizza with the matching toppings , to score maximum points\nThe game ends when anyone of the player completes his/her pizza ( 6 slices) by topping up all 6 slices with matching toppings.\nAfter the game ends the players will add the number of points scored.\n\nSCORING:\nAdd the number of points mentioned on the top of each pizza slice you completed (no points for incomplete slices)\nThe player who completed a whole pizza of 6 slices will be awarded with 15 bonus points.\n\nWinner:\nThe player with the maximum number of points wins the game.",

Enjoy in solo or multiplayer mode.\n\nCONTENTS:\nGame board\n45 Matharon cards\n60 Number tokens\n4 Player markers with stands (robots)\nPouch\nMedal\n\n\nSETUP\n\n\nPlace the game board in the center. Players can sit on 3 sides of the board.\n\nShuffle all the Matharon cards and place them in a pile faced down on the board (at the provided space).\nThen open the top 4 cards from the pile and place it on the board (at the provided space).\n\nEach player selects their robot player and collects 6 number tokens randomly drawn from the pouch.\n\nWe are now ready to run the Math-aron!\n\nGOAL: To be the first to finish the Matharon race\n\n\nHOW TO PLAY\n\nThe youngest player starts the game.\n\nAt the start, the first player chooses to solve one of the 4 Matharon cards open on the board using the number tokens he/she has.\n\n\nSolving a Matharon card: (Image needed)\n- Each Matharon card has blank spaces on the left and the right side of the equation. \n- You are allowed to keep only 1 token on each blank space on the left side of the equation, but upto 2 number tokens (to form 2 digit number) on the right of the equation.\n- If the blank space is coloured, the player can only use a token that matches the color of the space.If the blank space is white then you can use any color token\n\n\nAfter solving the card the player:\nMoves the number of steps shown on the card\nDiscards and replaces the solved card with the top card from the pile\nDiscards the used number tokens and replaces it with new number tokens by randomly drawing them from the pouch (All players should have 6 number tokens at any given point in the game)\n\n\n      5. Then the next player takes their turn to solve one of the 4 open cards.\n\n7. The game finishes when any one of the player lands on/crosses the finish line.\n\nimage Space: \n(image) Boost : Whenever the player lands on this space he/she can jump immediately to the next space\n(image) Extra token : Whenever the player lands on this space he/she can take one extra number token for his next turn (total 7).\n\n\n\n\nNote:\n*If a player is not able to solve a card on their turn, they may replace all their number tokens and the turn is passed to the next player.\n*If all cards have been played, shuffle all the discarded cards and make a new draw pile to play.\n\n\n\nWINNER\nThe first player to land/cross the finish line is the ultimate Matharon winner.
